Description:
Always use caution when handling sharp objects.
  • Hand wash knives with warm water and a mild detergent. Rinse and dry immediately.
  • Regular use of a honing steel maintains cutting edge

Sharpen knives as needed. This can be done by a professional or at home, using a whetstone or a knife sharpener. (The unique bevel of a santoku knife's blade requires the use of a sharpener designed exclusively for santoku knives.)
  • Avoid cutting on hard surfaces such as stone, metal or glass.
  • Store knives in a safe place to protect edge and prevent injury.
Name: Global Classic Steak Knives, Set of 4 | Williams Sonoma
